New Records: England won their second T20 World Cup, becoming the first team alongside the West Indies to achieve this feat
Key Match Events: England recovered from a poor start to win the match with six balls remaining
Ben Stokes scored an unbeaten 52 and Moeen Ali contributed 19 runs to guide England to victory
Pre-Game Insights: The victory added to England's 2019 50-over title, building on the legacy of former captain Eoin Morgan who retired this year after transforming the team into a white-ball juggernaut
Post-Match Reflections: The victory was celebrated by the players and the coach highlighted it as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was attended by 80,462 fans
The tournament spanned 45 games over nearly a month
